meanings.definition: To gather or build up over time.
meanings.sent1: She cumulates seashells on the beach every summer.
meanings.sent2: The snow cumulates on the mountain peaks during winter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel cumulates nuts in its treehouse for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account cumulates interest slowly but steadily.
meanings.sent5: The student cumulates knowledge throughout the school year.

meanings.sent1: He cumulates different colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The company cumulates data to analyze market trends.
meanings.sent3: The chef cumulates various spices to create a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: Their efforts cumulate into a successful team project.
meanings.sent5: The river cumulates debris after heavy rainfall.
